text.text_translated:
Businesses want to make money. This is called profitability. They see profitability in the sharing economy. The sharing economy uses resources. People do not use these resources enough.

This business idea became popular quickly. Companies give an online platform. This is a website or an app. It puts customers in contact with people. These people can give a product or a service.

Airbnb is an example. It acts like a middleman. It connects people who have rooms or houses. It connects them with people who want to stay there. People can 'cash in on' their unused rooms and houses. This means they make money from them. They 'let out' these places. They rent them to other people. This is 'lucrative accommodation'. It means they earn a lot of money.

Uber is another example. It encourages people to use their own personal cars like taxis. They can earn extra money in their free time.

feedback.feedback: FAIL: Fidelity Failure. The BERTScore of 0.8944 is below the required 0.90. This indicates a significant loss of key words and factual phrasing from the original text due to over-simplification and extensive rephrasing. For example, the original phrase 'caught on to the profitability' was replaced with 'want to make money. This is called profitability', and 'underutilised resources' was broken into 'resources. People do not use these resources enough', losing the original lexical density and direct phrasing. FAIL: CEFR Compliance. The CEFR classifier rated the text as B1, not A2. This is a critical deviation from the A2 standard. The text contains numerous words and phrases above the A2 level, even when definitions are provided. The presence of these words makes the text unsuitable for an A2 learner. Specific deviations include: The word 'profitability' is B1. The word 'economy' is B1. The word 'middleman' is B1. The idiom 'cash in on' is B1/B2. The phrasal verb 'let out' (in the context of renting) is B1. The word 'lucrative' is B1. The word 'accommodation' is B1. The word 'encourages' is B1. The word 'means' (used as 'this means') is B2. Suggestion: Replace all B1/B2 vocabulary with simpler A2 equivalents. For example, instead of 'profitability', use 'making money'. Instead of 'economy', use 'how people make and use money'. Instead of 'middleman', use 'a person or company that connects two groups'. Rephrase sentences to avoid idioms and complex phrasal verbs. Ensure all vocabulary is strictly A2.

best_attempt.text_translated: Businesses want to make a lot of money. They use things that people do not use enough. This is called the sharing economy. The sharing economy helps people share things and make money. This business idea became popular quickly. Companies give an online platform. This is a website or an app. It connects customers and people. These people can give a product or a service. Airbnb is an example. It acts like a middleman. It connects people who have rooms or houses. It connects them with people who want to stay there. People can earn a lot of money from their unused rooms and houses. They rent these places to other people. Uber is another example. It encourages people to use their own cars like taxis. They can earn extra money in their free time.
